caption: I really loved it. Great pieces were selected. There were not many people, so you could enjoy art in peace (unlike Louvre). I really recommend checking it out!
Well worth a visit, hotel next door not much to see plus wasn't told they are real rooms with guests in

It’s a bit pricey (20€ for the exposition and hotel) but it’s definitely worth it. The exposition is great. If you choose between exposition and hotel, I’d definitely recommend the first. The art is stunning and there aren’t many people. As for the hotel, it’s nice but a bit confusing: some rooms are open, but there was a half-open door to one and I wasn’t sure whether there were visitors inside or real guests. It was a bit awkward anyways 😅
Fantastic exhibition and really enjoyed seeing it. Very thought provoking. One Big Question Where does all the Money that's generated go to ???? I hope it's Charitable Causes.

My recent visit to the Banksy Museum in Paris was undeniably a memorable and enjoyable experience. As a fan of street art and Banksy's unique style, I was thrilled to explore the museum's collection, which did not disappoint.  The museum, while small in size, manages to pack a punch with its curated selection of Banksy's artworks. The pieces on display are not only thought-provoking but also a testament to Banksy's wit and creativity. The intimate atmosphere of the museum allowed me to get up close and personal with the art, enhancing my overall experience.  One thing to note is the option to purchase a combo ticket, which includes a visit to the museum and a stay at the associated hotel. However, I would advise against opting for this combo ticket. The hotel visit, unfortunately, did not match the same level of excitement and intrigue as the museum itself.

It's a scum. It will take you 20 minutes at max to go and READ every description of poorly made reproductions. But the worst part is that these descriptions are absolutely useless, shallow and are literally ChatGPT generated (repeating what we already see in the picture and using such chatgpt'y words like "poignant" and "depiction" all the time). I feel kinda dumb thinking it was an  official exhibition so don't make the same mistake and keep 14 euros to yourself.

Spend the bucks. Go see this place. These are reproductions and some good, but some bad interpretations of Banskys work.  Not a complete collection, but worth it to see how this guys mind works.  If in Paris this is a must stop.

A great opportunity to absorb the Banksy phenomena. To all street art lovers - a must. A unique experience that brings his/her work (nobody really knows who this person is for real) from many corners of the world. A small but very charming gallery exhibition!

Loved the museum.  The hotel part is not worth the money/time/visit.  We were disappointed as we had a combined ticket and did the hotel first 🤣 honestly even if the hotel part was free it's more than enough to visit the musée only.  (Photos below are basically all you see in the hotel visit by going up to the 1st and 2nd floor)

The World Of Banksy Expo enabled us to see the most iconic collection of Banksy. There were only few people at a same time so it' not overcrowded and we were allowed to enjoy the exposition piece by piece without any rush. It’s a perfect stop for those wanting to learn something more about his work with a powerful message expressed through street art.
One of the best museums in Paris!

Museum Art Paris A true story about Banksy. One day, he went to a flea market and tried to sell  his works, 50£ each. Lots people passed, looked and enjoyed his work, but no one buy. WHY? I have an idea. And you?

It's an amazing exhibition if you're into Banksy, or if you want to see a collection of his work from around the world in one place. As a bonus, they have recreated the Walled Off Hotel from Bethlehem in Palestine, where you can even spend the night. We decided just to visit. And of course, you exit through the gift shop... 😉 …
Intimate museum that is camouflaged in the streetscape in The Walled Off Hotel. Just like Banksy! Totally worth a visit.
Banksy's work is thought-provoking and highly relevant. It is a small museum, but worth the price if you value art that can spark great conversation.

If you’re a fan (or just curious) about Banksy’s work than this is the alternative museum/art gallery for you. Showcasing a number of Banksy’s most political pieces, this gallery is immersive in presenting them with street noises and additional props (paint cans, garbage) to add to the experience. Walk through two levels of open gallery space and admire the work, reading interesting explanations and interpretations along the way.  Not overly crowded, a bit pricey (12 Euro/person (consider the Louvre is 15 Euro/person), this gallery is nevertheless a worthwhile experience.

I never heard of this Baknsy before, but he seems like an anarchistisan artist with a stable hand for stancils and some good points. it might brings a plot twist in your millionaire life.  hail the rats.

Quite moving and eye-opening exhibition! It is a pity that you need a ticket to access the shop :-( I returned to buy some presents, after a couple of weeks, and it was not possible without a ticket… It definitely deserves a 5 star otherwise.
Popped in to shelter from the rain. What a find, and passed a very enjoyable and informative couple of hours.

Small museum close to our hotel. Opens late, so we were able to visit after an early dinner. Lots of Banksy recreated to see and fun trickets to purchase after. Learnt a lot about politics/ reasoning behind some of Banksy artwork. Sobering but enjoyable.
Gives a great perspective on Banksy's worked, with simple and clear explanations and the art work (quality reproductions) organised in themes.
Banksy art is provocating to think, great reproductions, 10/10

I love bansky art but there is something bizarre and out of place at seein his work replicated in the wrong enviroment. I did enjoy reading the interpretations of his work and discovering some i never heard about. I recommend only if you are around the area and like him enough.
You should visit this exhibition if you love Banksy! it  will not regret you.

A good option for a rainy afternoon if you have a teen to entertain. The exhibition is not huge, but large enough that you get a good idea of Banksy's work and "message".  A lot of his work, however, does not translate well into a gallery space, as of course a good part of Banksy's power and excitement results from his art popping up in unexpected places -  a rebellious, because illegal, gesture. However "alternative" the gallery's design might be, this aspect is completely neutralised here.  His art has long occupied that grey area between anti-establishment protest and clever self marketing. Fittingly, the whole gallery feels like a funnel leading you to the shop, which you can't bypass on your way out, as in most museums nowadays, to be fair. All in all, not an unpleasant experience, although not cheap and a little too mercantile for my taste.
Great place to get to know and experience Banksy

Its fine. Nothing excepcional regarding the display of the art. Art itself is know and always worth to see in the real sizes. But with the ticket price I would expect better exhibition organisation and presentation.

The exhibition was interesting. But I think it is not directly endorsed by Banksy and for that the price was honestly a bit too high (14€). They only had two/three larger exhibition rooms so we were done with the tour in like 35 minutes. Still 3 stars because Banksy‘s work is worth seeing.
The museum was ok, i would expect the staff to be less rude...

The man got angry because we bought tickets just before entering. It is interesting but not for €12 PP. the art isn’t really explained most of it just tells you what it is which is clearly observable. Wouldn’t advise you can just see the art on your phone.
This is an amazing alternative to the usual art museums. Due to time slots it wasn’t too crowded, and we’ve been able to enjoy the art at our own speed.
Great place to see most of his art on display in one place. Yes, they are reproductions but you can’t have one singular place to see all of Banksy anyway.

As with anything, if you like this type of work, you will like it. Though it is smaller than expected and the guy working in this tourist attraction didn’t seem to enjoy talking to tourists, it was nice to see Banksy pieces aligned. However, it also takes a little away from the strength of each piece which normally really works because the are such a contrast to their surroundings.  The whole idea of this as an art collection is ironic, verging on counter intuitive. But it was worth it just to see the life size wall installation.
Fans strike back - a heaven for Star Wars fans. Simply unbelievable. Best collection you could hope for
This was the highlight of my holiday. We got the ticket with the hotel tour too. Result .... I know who banksy is.... 🤫 …

Just not enough art for that price. For a third of the price it might be okay. But paying fourteen euros for two big rooms with banksy copies with very few and pretty general explanations is just too expensive. You feel pretty scammed afterwards. There are definitely much better places for art in Paris.

Ok but disappointing for the price. It is a relatively short exhibition about Banksy with some reproductions of his work, and descriptions in French and English. Some interesting descriptions on the signs were useful. And it wasn’t too crowded. However, the ticket price seems far too expensive for what it is at 20 euros. I was drawn in by the Walled off hotel sign and expectation that it was a re-creation of it. There is a re-creation of one room inside. There was a very unfriendly ticket man but the shop staff were friendly. Overall I would give it a miss and spend euros elsewhere in Paris.

The exhibition is well done, though...  I was disappointed with labeling of the products in the gift shop.  The products don’t have country of origin and no labels to prove ethical production. So, I have to presume that they’re made in developing countries under dreadful conditions.  “Exit through the gift shop”
